meanings.definition: The study of the end times or the final events in history.
meanings.sent1: In his eschatology class, they discussed prophecies about the end of the world.
meanings.sent2: Many religious texts include eschatology as a significant topic.
meanings.sent3: The professor's eschatology lecture was so fascinating that even the sleepy students perked up.
meanings.sent4: Her obsession with doomsday scenarios made her eschatology theories quite alarming.
meanings.sent5: The vivid imagery in the eschatology book painted a dramatic picture of the apocalypse.

meanings.definition: Beliefs or teachings concerning the ultimate destiny of humanity.
meanings.sent1: Different religions have varying eschatology beliefs about what happens after death.
meanings.sent2: His eschatology views shaped his perspective on life and morality.
meanings.sent3: The debate over eschatology among the scholars turned into a friendly argument.
meanings.sent4: Her optimistic eschatology outlook inspired hope in those around her.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization's eschatology myths were passed down through generations.
